page.title: 01YELLING VILLAGE COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: The countryside here is fairly flat but offers a few gentle undulations, arable farming predominates. Most farms have a small copse and some hedgerows survive. the mian crop is wheat, but barley, rape and some vegetables also prosper. the village of yelling contains four farmhouses and about ninty other houses. The architecture varies from thatched cottage to modern, reflecting a gradual increase in the size of the village. A focal point is the church, opposite it the old school is now a village hall and social club. Darts, flower arranging, slimnastics and W.I. meetings are regularly on offer. A limited bus service links the village to nearby towns and the children have a school bus service to primary and secondary schools about three miles away. Employment is limited to
